Player

Class WebServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player.NanoHTTPD
      • Player.WebServer

  • public class WebServer
extends NanoHTTPD
    Subclassing NanoHTTPD to make a custom HTTP server.

    • Method Detail

      • serve

        public NanoHTTPD.Response serve(java.lang.String uri,
                       java.lang.String method,
                       java.util.Properties header,
                       java.util.Properties parms,
                       java.util.Properties files,
                       java.net.Socket source)
        Serves and manages the web-based client interface.
        Overrides:
        serve in class NanoHTTPD
        Parameters:
        uri - Percent-decoded URI without parameters, for example "/index.cgi"
        method - "GET", "POST" etc.
        header - Header entries, percent decoded
        parms - Parsed, percent decoded parameters from URI and, in case of POST, data.
        Returns:
        HTTP response, see class Response for details

      • handleIndex

        public NanoHTTPD.Response handleIndex()
        Handles the index file.
        Returns:
        NanoHTTPD response including the index.html file.

      • getMainPageData

        public java.lang.String getMainPageData()
        Gets the main page data from MusicPlayerFrame and formats it for placing into an html file.
        Returns:
        Library track list, formatted for html display.

      • handleSearch

        public NanoHTTPD.Response handleSearch(java.lang.String searchParam)
        Handles the search function.
        Parameters:
        searchParam - The term to be searched for in the music library.
        Returns:
        A NanoHTTPD response, including the search results formatted for inclusion in an html file.

      • handleUpvote

        public NanoHTTPD.Response handleUpvote(java.lang.String[] params)
        Handles the upvote function.
        Parameters:
        params - Integer identifier (in string form) of the song to be upvoted.
        Returns:
        NanoHTTPD response, including a re-built library track list (to reflect the applied upvote).
